title: Migrant boat capsizes off Libya leaving 53 dead
content: The IOM says that almost 500 people have been reported dead or missing off Libya so far this year.

content: Police say the "transnational" criminal group has been in operation since 2017.

content: One case in California focuses on addiction, while another in New Mexico targets access to explicit material.

title: Epstein survivors call for full release of files in video
content: Millions of files relating to the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein have been released by the DOJ but many have redactions.

originalTitle: 'Didn't want the season to end like this' - Grealish has surgery
title: 'Didn't want the season to end like this' - Grealish has surgery
content: Jack Grealish says he "didn't want the season to end like this" after confirming he has had surgery on a foot stress fracture.

originalTitle: Late goals are destroying Liverpool's season and solution isn't obvious
title: Super Reds and the Late Game Puzzle!
content:
Jambo, Amazing Football Friends!

Jambo, amazing football friends! It's your kid-friendly reporter here, ready to share some exciting news from the big world of football! Today, we're going to talk about a super famous team that wears red jerseys, called Liverpool. Have you ever heard of them? They play football in a faraway land called England, but many of us here in Africa love watching them play! Imagine you and your friends are playing your favorite game outside. You're running, laughing, and trying your very best, right? That's what football players do too! They run on a big green field, kick a round ball, and try to score goals into a net. It's all about teamwork and having lots of fun!

What's Happening with Our Red Friends?

Now, sometimes, even the best teams face little puzzles. For Liverpool, something a bit tricky has been happening this year. They play super well for most of the game, scoring goals and defending bravely. But then, sometimes, when the game is almost, almost finished, the other team manages to score a goal against them! It's a bit like when you're building a super tall tower with blocks, and right at the very end, one little block wiggles, and the tower becomes a bit shaky. In football, if a team is not super focused until the very last sound of the whistle, tricky things can happen. Did you know? A football game usually lasts for 90 minutes, which is a long time! That's like playing for an hour and a half!

The 'Mentality Monsters' Story!

Not so long ago, people used to call Liverpool 'mentality monsters.' Wow! What a strong name! It just means they were super-duper strong in their minds. They never, ever gave up, no matter what. Even if another team scored, they would fight back with all their might and try to win until the very last second. They had big, brave hearts! They would keep running, keep tackling, and keep trying to score, even when they were super tired. That's what made them so special. They showed everyone how important it is to be strong not just with your legs, but with your mind too! Did you know? A 'monster' in this football story isn't scary at all! It just means they were incredibly strong and determined!

The Big Puzzle Now

But this year, it's a bit different. Sometimes, it seems like that super-strong 'mentality monster' feeling doesn't last for the whole game. Other teams are finding it a bit easier to score against Liverpool right at the very end. This means Liverpool might not win the game, even if they were playing fantastic for most of it. Sometimes they draw (which means both teams get the same score), or they might even lose. This is a big puzzle for the team and their coach. They are trying to figure out how to be super strong, focused, and brave for every single minute of the game, right until the final whistle blows and says 'game over'! Did you know? The coach is like the captain of a ship, guiding the players and telling them the best ways to play!

Working Hard to Be Super Strong Again!

No need to worry too much, my friends! The Liverpool players and their wonderful coach are working super, super hard every day. Just like you practice your reading or drawing to get better, they practice running, kicking, and, most importantly, working together as a team. They are talking to each other, training hard, and trying to remember that amazing 'mentality monster' spirit they had before. They know that every player needs to focus and work together, like a big family, for the whole game. It's not easy, but they are trying their very best to find their super strength and keep it going until the end! Did you know? In football, a 'team' is usually made up of 11 players on the field at one time, all working together!

Why This Is Important for All of Us!

This story about Liverpool is not just about football; it's about life too! It teaches us that even when things are tricky, and you're feeling a bit tired or things aren't going your way, it's super important to keep trying your best until the very, very end. Whether you're playing a game, doing your homework, or helping your family, always remember to try with all your heart and never give up! That's the real spirit of a 'mentality monster' – a super strong, never-give-up spirit! We know Liverpool is a wonderful team with brave players. We believe they will find their super strength again and play with all their hearts until the very, very end! We are cheering for them! That's all for today's football news, my little champions! Keep playing, keep trying your best, and remember to always have fun and work together!
summary: Liverpool, a famous football team, is facing a challenge where other teams sometimes score against them right at the end of games, and they are working hard to bring back their super-strong, never-give-up spirit.
whyMatters: This story teaches us that even the best teams sometimes face challenges, and it's important to keep trying our best, stay focused, and work together until the very end, just like in games and in life!

originalTitle: Rosenior 'not bothered' by David Brent and Inbetweeners comparisons
title: Rosenior 'not bothered' by David Brent and Inbetweeners comparisons
content: Chelsea manager Liam Rosenior says he is not "bothered at all" by memes comparing him to tongue-in-cheek television characters.
